response:
Immediate imaging is required to visualize the spinal cord intrinsic structure and rule out surgical compression. Assessment of respiratory function is critical given the presenting complaint. CSF and serology are necessary to distinguish between inflammatory, infectious, and autoimmune etiologies.

investigations = ["MRI Cervical Spine with contrast", "MRI Brain", "Bedside Spirometry (Forced Vital Capacity)", "Lumbar Puncture (CSF microscopy, culture, protein, glucose, oligoclonal bands)", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "C-reactive protein", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate", "Aquaporin-4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "HIV serology", "Syphilis serology", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ENA)"]
